p: Fig 1 shows the proportion of respondents falling into the six different segments in 2011 and 2016. The key result is that there has been a leftward movement during the period towards the Alarmed and Concerned categories and away from the Doubtful and Dismissive groups. With a Chi-square value of 48.83, the difference is statistically significant. While there is an increased proportion in the Alarmed group (from 15.0% to 17.5%), the major shifts are out of the Doubtful and Dismissive groups and into the Cautious and Disengaged groups. With 32.7% now in these latter two groups (up from 26.8%), there would be a higher likelihood of climate change messages being effective because Morrison et al. [ 16] showed that members of these two groups are likely to have their opinions on climate change issues easily changed.
